title: Bubble Markets Display Bizarre Behavior Right Before They Tumble
text: The typical signs of an approaching bubble bust were on full display in the equity markets last week, like the dot-com bubble of the 90s.

title: Stock market: 'The power of social media is making its way to Wall Street'
text: This segment originally aired on January 27, 2021 Yahoo Finance's Zack Guzman and Akiko Fujita break down the stock market with Victoria Greene, G Squared Private Wealth Founding Partner and Portfolio Manager, and Jeffrey Weiner, Marcum LLP Chairman & CEO. title: The S&P 500 is seen as a gauge of the stock market itself — here's how this widely watched stock index works
text: People often say "The stock market is up," or "The market is down." But the stock market is an amorphous thing, encompassing thousands of equities and dozens of stock exchanges. What they actually mean is a particular stock market index, or group of publicly traded companies, is up or down. And if they're in the US, odds are that index is the Standard & Poor's 500, or S&P 500.

title: CNBC's Santoli: Short hedge funds aren't ‘powerful predators'
text: The epic battle playing out in GameStop Corp.'s (NYSE: GME) stock isn't the David versus Goliath battle some in the media play it out to be. In fact, hedge funds are far from the “all-powerful predators” that make a killing shorting stocks to zero, according to CNBC's Michael Santoli.

title: Week Ahead - Volatility Going Nowhere
text: While the battle between retail investors and hedge funds may continue to dominate the headlines in the coming weeks, there is plenty more that investors should pay close attention to. The two big data releases for the US will be the ISM manufacturing and the employment report.

title: GameStop Short Covering Is Not Responsible For The Markets Falling Last Week

title: Here's what Bank of America has to say about WSB vs short-sellers
text: In a week that has been marked by the direct confrontation between short-selling hedge funds and retail investors centered around Reddit's Wallstreetbets forum, major financial institutions have joined the debate. War on Equality For Michael Hartnett, the Chief Investment Strategist at Bank of America, the ongoing drama represents “another escalation in War on Inequality”.

text: The IPO market is expected to remain active in the week ahead with nine IPOs scheduled to raise $2.7 billion. Canadian digital service provider TELUS International plans to raise $800 million at a $6.4 billion market cap.

title: MacroView: 2021 - A Disappointment Of Growth And Disinflation
text: As we head into 2021, there is a large consensus that the massive monetary interventions in 2020 will lead to an explosion of economic growth, inflation, and higher interest rates. We suspect that the outcome of more debt-driven spending will lead to a disappointment in growth and disinflation instead.

title: What is a SPAC? Explaining one of Wall Street's hottest trends
text: SPACs, which allow private companies to go public without a traditional IPO, raise billions of dollars in 2020. Here's how they work.

title: Billionaire Investor Says Buy Office And Urban REITs And Avoid Big Tech
text: Billionaire investor Sam Zell is bullish on real estate despite the COVID crisis. He does not buy into the work-from-home hype and expects urbanization to continue for decades to come.

title: Economic Report: The U.S. may have lost jobs again in January, but the economy is ripe for rebound
text: The U.S. jobs market could also use a shot in the arm, just like the millions of Americans who are getting life-saving vaccines against the coronavirus. The economy lost jobs in December for the first time since the onset of the pandemic and employment could fall again in January.

title: Market Snapshot: ‘Bumpier' path to normal from uneven vaccine rollout alarms U.S. stock-market bulls
text: The naysayers warn recent delays and shortages in vaccine deliveries have started to gnaw away at the stock market's confidence that the U.S. economy will recover quickly this year when immunity to the coronavirus begins to build up in the population.

title: Real Gross Domestic Product Posted A Solid Gain In The Fourth Quarter, But Remains Below Trend
text: Real gross domestic product rose at a 4.0 percent annualized rate in the fourth quarter, down from a 33.4 percent pace in the third quarter. Measured from fourth quarter 2019 to fourth quarter 2020, real gross domestic product decreased 2.5 percent.

title: Should Dividend Investors Buy Preferred Stock? An Expert Explains the Pros and Cons
text: All dividend stocks are not the same. Even if they're issued by the same company.

title: Focus On The Fundamentals
text: Volatility in the financial markets accelerated last week due to the "games" being played by short sellers. Many investors believe these moves represent added risk and raised some cash taking risk-off.

title: Federal Reserve Watch: Credit Inflation Is Alive And Well
text: The Federal Reserve has two goals: first to get inflation rising for an extended period of time so as to, two, reduce the unemployment rate. The Fed for the time being is committed to keep buying $120 billion of securities outright per month, making sure it errs on the side of too much monetary ease.

title: Why Wealthsimple Refuses to Restrict Trading
text: Jan.29 -- The Reddit-fueled rally in the likes of GameStop, BlackBerry and AMC prompted U.S. no-fee trading platform Robinhood to restrict the types of transactions retail investors could make in the names, prompting outrage. In Canada, Wealthsimple did no such thing, allowing investors to trade freely in those securities, helping drive the trading platform to the top of the app store.

title: The Week On Wall Street: Let The Games Begin
text: There is a "mania" out there, but it is hardly “everywhere”. Earnings remain robust, and companies are raising guidance. The data doesn't lie; economic reports continue to roll in at or above pre-pandemic levels, and no one is talking about them.

title: Weekly High Frequency Indicators: Commodities, Jobless Claims Change In Short Leading Forecast
text: High frequency indicators can give us a nearly up-to-the-moment view of the economy. The metrics are divided into long leading, short leading, and coincident indicators. Vaccinations remain the most decisive single metric for now.
